intro: Veratrum maackii var. japonicum, commonly known as Japanese false hellebore, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems that can reach up to 2 meters in height. The plant produces large, showy white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typically blooming in late summer. Its leaves are large, lance-shaped, and often have a waxy coating, while its roots contain toxic alkaloids. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
